item.title: 美国贸易赤字扩大，进口创2022年以来最大增幅
item.description: 美国 11 月份的贸易逆差有所扩大，反映了自 2022 年 3 月以来最大的进口跃升，原因是在码头工人可能举行罢工之前，以及预期特朗普政府可能征收关税，企业加快了发货速度。【原文：The US trade deficit widened in November, reflecting the biggest jump in imports since March 2022 as companies accelerated shipments ahead of a possible dockworkers’ strike and in anticipation of potential tariffs by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 特朗普回国前加拿大对美贸易顺差扩大
item.description: 加拿大与美国的贸易顺差扩大，与世界其他国家的贸易逆差也在扩大，这凸显了加拿大最大的贸易伙伴和南部邻国在其经济中发挥的重要作用。【原文：Canada’s trade surplus with the US widened as did its deficit with the rest of the world, underscoring the major role its biggest trading partner and southern neighbor plays in its economy.】

item.title: 破产的 Northvolt 寻求投资者批准继续生产电池
item.description: 破产的电动汽车供应商 Northvolt AB 正在请求股东批准继续生产电池芯，同时寻求摆脱破产保护所需的新资金。【原文：Northvolt AB is asking for shareholder approval to keep building battery cells while the bankrupt electric-vehicle supplier seeks the new funding needed to emerge from Chapter 11 protection.】

item.title: 油轮老板预计伊朗制裁压力将提高收益
item.description: 世界上最大的油轮公司之一的老板说，最近加强对伊朗和俄罗斯石油流动制裁的举措应该会提高原油运输船的收益。【原文：The boss of one of the world’s largest tanker companies said recent moves to tighten sanctions on Iranian and Russian oil flows should boost earnings for crude-carrying vessels.】

item.title: CoreLogic 称澳大利亚房地产下滑可能是 "短暂的
item.description: CoreLogic Inc.公司称，澳大利亚房地产市场的衰退可能是 "浅层的、短暂的"，但在住房可负担性改善之前，很难看到经济恢复增长。【原文：Australia’s housing market downturn is likely to be “shallow and short-lived,” though it’s hard to see growth returning until home affordability improves, according to CoreLogic Inc.】

item.title: 在米莱和卢拉之间，巴拉圭财政部长选择了紧缩之路
item.description: 拉丁美洲正在成为政府极端支出的战场，小国呼吁在后果蔓延到其他国家之前勒紧裤腰带。【原文：Latin America is becoming a battleground of government spending extremes, drawing calls from smaller nations to tighten the belt before the consequences spill across borders.】

item.title: 智利年底铜矿暴利预示矿业正在复苏
item.description: 尽管铜价下跌，但智利 12 月份的铜出口收入仍大幅增长，这表明这个产量最高的国家的铜矿已从 20 年来的最低水平开始复苏。【原文：Chile’s copper export revenue jumped in December, despite lower prices for the metal, indicating that mines in the top-producing country extended a recovery from the lowest levels in two decades.】

item.title: 德国 12 月通胀率从 2.9% 更正为 2.8%
item.description: 德国统计局的数据显示，德国上个月的通货膨胀率从 11 月份的 2.4% 上升至 2.8%。【原文：German inflation accelerated to 2.8% last month, up from 2.4% in November, according to the country’s statistics office.】

item.description: 智利正在利用国际债务市场，与墨西哥和匈牙利等国一道，参与本周繁忙的售债活动。【原文：Chile is tapping international debt markets, joining nations from Mexico to Hungary in what is shaping out to be a busy week for debt sales.】

item.title: 如何理解新时代特朗普世界的关税政策辩论
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫还有将近两周的时间，但他的关税计划已经在金融市场引起了轩然大波。对于任何关注此事的人来说，即将发生的事情都是值得借鉴的。【原文：Donald Trump is almost two weeks away from returning to the White House and yet his tariff plans are already causing whiplash in financial markets. And for anyone paying attention, there’s a lesson to be had there in what’s coming.】

item.title: 恩智浦同意以 6.25 亿美元收购汽车软件制造商
item.description: 芯片制造商恩智浦半导体公司（NXP Semiconductors NV）同意以 6.25 亿美元现金收购奥地利汽车软件开发商 TTTech Auto，为软件定义汽车制造商开发产品。【原文：Chipmaker NXP Semiconductors NV agreed to buy Austrian automotive software developer TTTech Auto for $625 million in cash to build out its products for software-defined vehicle makers.】

item.title: 受美国关税言论和利率押注影响，兹罗提逼近五年高点
item.description: 波兰兹罗提兑欧元汇率接近2020年初以来的最强水平，原因是市场押注波兰国内将采取进一步的限制性货币政策，同时希望美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的第二任期对新兴市场资产的破坏性较小。【原文：Poland’s zloty traded near the strongest level against the euro since early 2020 on bets for further restrictive monetary policy at home and hopes for a less disruptive second term from US President-elect Donald Trump for emerging-market assets.】

item.title: 俄罗斯称 12 月原油产量减至欧佩克+目标以下
item.description: 据熟悉俄罗斯能源部数据的人士称，俄罗斯自己的数据显示，其 12 月份的原油产量低于欧佩克+的目标。【原文：Russia’s own data show its crude production in December fell below its OPEC+ target, according to people familiar with figures from the country’s Energy Ministry.】

And then compares that against how much yield an investor would earn from bonds. The classic view is that stocks should have a higher “earnings yield” because they are so much riskier. But with equities】

item.title: 美国将中国科技巨头列入黑名单有可能导致更快脱钩
item.description: 美国扩大中国军工企业名单的最新举动所带来的风险不仅仅是使中国一些最有价值的公司股价下跌：它还可能加速世界最大经济体的脱钩。【原文：The US’s latest move to expand its list of Chinese military companies risks doing more than tanking the shares of some of its most valuable companies: It also threatens to accelerate decoupling of the world’s biggest economies.】

item.title: 信贷市场发出信号，警告股市无情反弹
item.description: 美国债券市场发出的信号是，股票多头现在可能有点过于亢奋了。【原文：US bond markets are signaling that equity bulls may be a little too exuberant now.】

item.title: 英国将根据扩大后的科技权力开展两项数字市场调查
item.description: 英国反垄断监管机构本月将利用其扩大的权力对一些最大的科技公司展开两项调查，以遏制其在数字市场中的支配地位。【原文：The UK’s antitrust watchdog will start two investigations this month into some of the largest tech companies using its expanded powers to curb dominance in digital markets, the regulator said without naming the firms that could come under the net.】

item.title: 欧洲债券市场单日发行量超历史水平
item.description: 本周二，在欧洲出售债券的借款人数量创下历史新高，他们从假期归来，以利用接近三年来最窄的利差。【原文：A record number of borrowers are selling bonds in Europe on Tuesday, returning from the holidays to take advantage of spreads that are near the tightest in three years.】

item.title: 印度经济将出现大流行病以来最弱增长
item.description: 在消费者削减开支和公共投资放缓之后，印度政府将本财政年度的经济增长预期下调至大流行病以来最弱的水平。【原文：India’s government lowered its economic growth projection for the fiscal year to the weakest since the pandemic after consumers cut back on spending and public investment slowed.】

item.title: 欧元区通胀反弹但不会阻碍欧洲央行降息
item.description: 上个月，欧元区通胀加速，支持了欧洲中央银行的渐进式降息策略，但并未使其完全脱轨。【原文：Euro-area inflation accelerated last month, supporting the European Central Bank’s gradual approach to reducing interest rates, without derailing them altogether.】

item.title: 印尼加入金砖国家，助推全球南方在世界舞台上的发展
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策给世界经济带来风险之际，印尼成为金砖国家集团的最新成员，此举将进一步支持全球南方国家。【原文：Indonesia has become the newest member of the BRICS group of developing nations, in a move that could further bolster the Global South as Donald Trump’s trade policies pose risks to world economy.】

item.title: 匈牙利开始 2025 年欧洲债券发行活动，未受疲软福林影响
item.description: 匈牙利坚持在年初获得国际融资的做法，并没有因为福林跌至两年来的低点而气馁。【原文：Hungary is sticking with its practice of securing international financing early in the year, undeterred by the forint’s slide toward two-year lows.】

item.title: 英国住宅建设连续第三个月下降，斯塔默遭遇挫折
item.description: 由于高利率和脆弱的消费者信心有可能阻碍工党政府促进建筑业发展的承诺，英国房屋建设以六个月来最快的速度下降。【原文：UK housebuilding dropped at the fastest pace in six months, as high interest rates and fragile consumer confidence threatened to hamper the Labour government’s pledge to boost construction.】
